summary.long: Isaiah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, heavens,
    and listen, earth; for Yahweh has spoken:
“I have nourished and brought up children
    and they have rebelled against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ox knows his owner,
    and the donkey his master’s crib;
    but Israel doesn’t know.
    My people don’t consider.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ah sinful nation,
    a people loaded with iniquity,
    offspring of evildoers,
    children who deal corruptly!
They have forsaken Yahweh.
    They have despised the Holy One of Israel.
    They are estranged and backward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should you be beaten more,
    that you revolt more and more?
The whole head is sick,
    and the whole heart faint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the sole of the foot even to the head there is no soundness in it,
    but wounds, welts, and open sores.
    They haven’t been closed, bandaged, or soothed with oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your country is desolate.
    Your cities are burned with fire.
    Strangers devour your land in your presence
    and it is desolate,
    as overthrown by strangers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The daughter of Zion is left like a shelter in a vineyard,
    like a hut in a field of melons,
    like a besieged city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unless Yahweh of Armies had left to us a very small remnant,
    we would have been as Sodom.
    We would have been like Gomorrah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear Yahweh’s word, you rulers of Sodom!
    Listen to the law of our God, you people of Gomorrah!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What are the multitude of your sacrifices to me?”, says Yahweh.
    “I have had enough of the burnt offerings of rams
    and the fat of fed animals.
    I don’t delight in the blood of bulls,
    or of lambs,
    or of male goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you come to appear before me,
    who has required this at your hand, to trample my courts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bring no more vain offerings.
    Incense is an abomination to me.
    New moons, Sabbaths, and convocations—
    I can’t stand evil assemblies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul hates your New Moons and your appointed feasts.
    They are a burden to me.
    I am weary of bearing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you spread out your hands, I will hide my eyes from you.
    Yes, when you make many prayers, I will not hear.
    Your hands are full of blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wash yourselves. Make yourself clean.
    Put away the evil of your doings from before my eyes.
    Cease to do evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Learn to do well.
    Seek justice.
    Relieve the oppressed.
Defend the fatherless.
    Plead for the widow.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Come now, and let’s reason together,” says Yahweh:
    “Though your sins are as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow.
    Though they are red like crimson, they shall be as wool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you are willing and obedient,
    you will eat the good of the land;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but if you refuse and rebel, you will be devoured with the sword;
    for Yahweh’s mouth has spoken it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How the faithful city has become a prostitute!
    She was full of justice.
Righteousness lodged in her,
    but now there are murderers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your silver has become dross,
    your wine mixed with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your princes are rebellious and companions of thieves.
    Everyone loves bribes and follows after rewards.
    They don’t defend the fatherless,
    neither does the cause of the widow come to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the Lord, Yahweh of Armies,
    the Mighty One of Israel, says:
“Ah, I will get relief from my adversaries,
    and avenge myself on my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will turn my hand on you,
    thoroughly purge away your dross,
    and will take away all your tin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will restore your judges as at the first,
    and your counselors as at the beginning.
Afterward you shall be called ‘The city of righteousness,
    a faithful town.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zion shall be redeemed with justice,
    and her converts with righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the destruction of transgressors and sinners shall be together,
    and those who forsake Yahweh shall be consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which you have desired,
    and you shall be confounded for the gardens that you have chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you shall be as an oak whose leaf fades,
    and as a garden that has no water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The strong will be like tinder,
    and his work like a spark.
They will both burn together,
    and no one will quench them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Many peoples shall go and say,
    “Come, let’s go up to the mountain of Yahweh,
    to the house of the God of Jacob;
    and he will teach us of his ways,
    and we will walk in his paths.”
For the law shall go out of Zion,
    and Yahweh’s word from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will judge between the nations,
    and will decide concerning many peoples.
    They shall beat their swords into plowshares,
    and their spears into pruning hooks.
Nation shall not lift up sword against nation,
    neither shall they learn war any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: House of Jacob, come, and let’s walk in the light of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have forsaken your people, the house of Jacob,
    because they are filled from the east,
    with those who practice divination like the Philistines,
    and they clasp hands with the children of foreigners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their land is full of silver and gold,
    neither is there any end of their treasures.
Their land also is full of horses,
    neither is there any end of their chariots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their land also is full of idols.
    They worship the work of their own hands,
    that which their own fingers have made.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Enter into the rock,
    and hide in the dust,
from before the terror of Yahweh,
    and from the glory of his majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lofty looks of man will be brought low,
    the arrogance of men will be bowed down,
    and Yahweh alone will be exalted in that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there will be a day of Yahweh of Armies for all that is proud and arrogant,
    and for all that is lifted up,
    and it shall be brought low—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for all the cedars of Lebanon, that are high and lifted up,
    for all the oaks of Bashan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for all the high mountains,
    for all the hills that are lifted up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for every lofty tower,
    for every fortified wall,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for all the ships of Tarshish,
    and for all pleasant imagery.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The idols shall utterly pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Men shall go into the caves of the rocks,
    and into the holes of the earth,
    from before the terror of Yahweh,
    and from the glory of his majesty,
    when he arises to shake the earth mightily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In that day, men shall cast away their idols of silver
    and their idols of gold,
    which have been made for themselves to worship,
    to the moles and to the bats,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to go into the caverns of the rocks,
    and into the clefts of the ragged rocks,
    from before the terror of Yahweh,
    and from the glory of his majesty,
    when he arises to shake the earth mightily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Stop trusting in man, whose breath is in his nostrils;
    for of what account is he?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
the mighty man,
    the man of war,
    the judge,
    the prophet,
    the diviner,
    the elder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the captain of fifty,
    the honorable man,
    the counselor,
    the skilled craftsman,
    and the clever enchanter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give boys to be their princes,
    and children shall rule over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people will be oppressed,
    everyone by another,
    and everyone by his neighbor.
The child will behave himself proudly against the old man,
    and the wicked against the honorable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed a man shall take hold of his brother in the house of his father, saying,
    “You have clothing, you be our ruler,
    and let this ruin be under your hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The look of their faces testify against them.
    They parade their sin like Sodom.
    They don’t hide it.
    Woe to their soul!
    For they have brought disaster upon themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tell the righteous that it will be well with them,
    for they will eat the fruit of their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to the wicked!
    Disaster is upon them,
    for the deeds of their hands will be paid back to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for my people, children are their oppressors,
    and women rule over them.
    My people, those who lead you cause you to err,
    and destroy the way of your paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh stands up to contend,
    and stands to judge the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh will enter into judgment with the elders of his people
    and their leaders:
    “It is you who have eaten up the vineyard.
    The plunder of the poor is in your houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What do you mean that you crush my people,
    and grind the face of the poor?” says the Lord, Yahweh of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover Yahweh said, “Because the daughters of Zion are arrogant,
    and walk with outstretched necks and flirting eyes,
    walking daintily as they go,
    jingling ornaments on their feet;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
therefore the Lord brings sores on the crown of the head of the women of Zion,
    and Yahweh will make their scalps bald.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day the Lord will take away the beauty of their anklets, the headbands, the crescent necklaces,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the earrings, the bracelets, the veils,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the headdresses, the ankle chains, the sashes, the perfume containers, the charms,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the signet rings, the nose rings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fine robes, the capes, the cloaks, the purses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the hand mirrors, the fine linen garments, the tiaras, and the shawls.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your men shall fall by the sword,
    and your mighty in the war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her gates shall lament and mourn.
    She shall be desolate and sit on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven women shall take hold of one man in that day, saying, “We will eat our own bread, and wear our own clothing. Just let us be called by your name. Take away our reproach.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day, Yahweh’s branch will be beautiful and glorious, and the fruit of the land will be the beauty and glory of the survivors of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen that he who is left in Zion and he who remains in Jerusalem shall be called holy, even everyone who is written among the living in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the Lord shall have washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and shall have purged the blood of Jerusalem from within it, by the spirit of justice and by the spirit of burning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh will create over the whole habitation of Mount Zion and over her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day, and the shining of a flaming fire by night, for over all the glory will be a canopy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be a pavilion for a shade in the daytime from the heat, and for a refuge and for a shelter from storm and from rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me sing for my well beloved a song of my beloved about his vineyard.
    My beloved had a vineyard on a very fruitful hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He dug it up,
    gathered out its stones,
    planted it with the choicest vine,
    built a tower in the middle of it,
    and also cut out a wine press in it.
He looked for it to yield grapes,
    but it yielded wild grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Now, inhabitants of Jerusalem and men of Judah,
    please judge between me and my vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What could have been done more to my vineyard, that I have not done in it?
    Why, when I looked for it to yield grapes, did it yield wild grapes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard.
    I will take away its hedge, and it will be eaten up.
    I will break down its wall, and it will be trampled down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will lay it a wasteland.
    It won’t be pruned or hoed,
    but it will grow briers and thorns.
    I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain on it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the vineyard of Yahweh of Armies is the house of Israel,
    and the men of Judah his pleasant plant.
    He looked for justice, but behold, oppression,
    for righteousness, but behold, a cry of distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to those who join house to house,
    who lay field to field, until there is no room,
    and you are made to dwell alone in the middle of the land!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In my ears, Yahweh of Armies says: “Surely many houses will be desolate,
    even great and beautiful, unoccupied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath,
    and a homer of seed shall yield an ephah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to those who rise up early in the morning, that they may follow strong drink,
    who stay late into the night, until wine inflames them!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore my people go into captivity for lack of knowledge.
    Their honorable men are famished,
    and their multitudes are parched with thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
but Yahweh of Armies is exalted in justice,
    and God the Holy One is sanctified in righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the lambs will graze as in their pasture,
    and strangers will eat the ruins of the rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to those who draw iniquity with cords of falsehood,
    and wickedness as with cart rope,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to those who are wise in their own eyes,
    and prudent in their own sight!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to those who are mighty to drink wine,
    and champions at mixing strong drink;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who acquit the guilty for a bribe,
    but deny justice for the innocent!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore as the tongue of fire devours the stubble,
    and as the dry grass sinks down in the flame,
    so their root shall be as rottenness,
    and their blossom shall go up as dust,
because they have rejected the law of Yahweh of Armies,
    and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore Yahweh’s anger burns against his people,
    and he has stretched out his hand against them and has struck them.
The mountains tremble,
    and their dead bodies are as refuse in the middle of the streets.
For all this, his anger is not turned away,
    but his hand is still stretched out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will lift up a banner to the nations from far away,
    and he will whistle for them from the end of the earth.
    Behold, they will come speedily and swiftly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one shall be weary nor stumble among them;
    no one shall slumber nor sleep,
    neither shall the belt of their waist be untied,
    nor the strap of their sandals be broken,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
whose arrows are sharp,
    and all their bows bent.
Their horses’ hoofs will be like flint,
    and their wheels like a whirlwind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their roaring will be like a lioness.
    They will roar like young lions.
Yes, they shall roar,
    and seize their prey and carry it off,
    and there will be no one to deliver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will roar against them in that day like the roaring of the sea.
    If one looks to the land, behold, darkness and distress.
    The light is darkened in its clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord sitting on a throne, high and lifted up; and his train filled the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Above him stood the seraphim. Each one had six wings. With two he covered his face. With two he covered his feet. With two he flew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One called to another, and said,
“Holy, holy, holy, is Yahweh of Armies!
    The whole earth is full of his glory!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The foundations of the thresholds shook at the voice of him who called, and the house was filled with smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “Woe is me! For I am undone, because I am a man of unclean lips and I live among a people of unclean lips, for my eyes have seen the King, Yahweh of Armies!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the seraphim flew to me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He touched my mouth with it, and said, “Behold, this has touched your lips; and your iniquity is taken away, and your sin forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I heard the Lord’s voice, saying, “Whom shall I send, and who will go for us?”
Then I said, “Here I am. Send me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “Go, and tell this people,
‘You hear indeed,
    but don’t understand.
You see indeed,
    but don’t perceive.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make the heart of this people fat.
    Make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes;
lest they see with their eyes,
    hear with their ears,
    understand with their heart,
    and turn again, and be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, “Lord, how long?”
He answered,
“Until cities are waste without inhabitant,
    houses without man,
    the land becomes utterly waste,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and Yahweh has removed men far away,
    and the forsaken places are many within the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If there is a tenth left in it,
    that also will in turn be consumed,
as a terebinth, and as an oak whose stump remains when they are cut down,
    so the holy seed is its stump.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, Rezin the king of Syria and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up to Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David’s house was told, “Syria is allied with Ephraim.” His heart trembled, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the forest tremble with the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to Isaiah, “Go out now to meet Ahaz, you, and Shearjashub your son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool, on the highway of the fuller’s field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell him, ‘Be careful, and keep calm. Don’t be afraid, neither let your heart be faint because of these two tails of smoking torches, for the fierce anger of Rezin and Syria, and of the son of Remaliah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah, have plotted evil against you, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let’s go up against Judah, and tear it apart, and let’s divide it among ourselves, and set up a king within it, even the son of Tabeel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord Yahweh says: “It shall not stand, neither shall it happen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the head of Syria is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is Rezin. Within sixty-five years Ephraim shall be broken in pieces, so that it shall not be a people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is Remaliah’s son. If you will not believe, surely you shall not be established.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke again to Ahaz, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ask a sign of Yahweh your God; ask it either in the depth, or in the height above.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Ahaz said, “I won’t ask. I won’t tempt Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Listen now, house of David. Is it not enough for you to try the patience of men, that you will try the patience of my God also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign. Behold, the virgin will conceive, and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall eat butter and honey when he knows to refuse the evil and choose the good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For before the child knows to refuse the evil and choose the good, the land whose two kings you abhor shall be forsaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh will bring on you, on your people, and on your father’s house days that have not come, from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah, even the king of Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen in that day that Yahweh will whistle for the fly that is in the uttermost part of the rivers of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall come, and shall all rest in the desolate valleys, in the clefts of the rocks, on all thorn hedges, and on all pastures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day the Lord will shave with a razor that is hired in the parts beyond the River, even with the king of Assyria, the head and the hair of the feet; and it shall also consume the beard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall happen in that day that a man shall keep alive a young cow, and two sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall happen, that because of the abundance of milk which they shall give he shall eat butter, for everyone will eat butter and honey that is left within the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen in that day that every place where there were a thousand vines worth a thousand silver shekels, will be for briers and thorns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will go there with arrows and with bow, because all the land will be briers and thorns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the hills that were cultivated with the hoe, you shall not come there for fear of briers and thorns; but it shall be for the sending out of oxen, and for sheep to tread on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to me, “Take a large tablet, and write on it with a man’s pen, ‘For Maher Shalal Hash Baz’;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will take for myself faithful witnesses to testify: Uriah the priest, and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I went to the prophetess, and she conceived, and bore a son. Then Yahweh said to me, “Call his name ‘Maher Shalal Hash Baz.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For before the child knows how to say, ‘My father’ and ‘My mother,’ the riches of Damascus and the plunder of Samaria will be carried away by the king of Assyria.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to me yet again, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Because this people has refused the waters of Shiloah that go softly, and rejoice in Rezin and Remaliah’s son;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: now therefore, behold, the Lord brings upon them the mighty flood waters of the River: the king of Assyria and all his glory. It will come up over all its channels, and go over all its banks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will sweep onward into Judah. It will overflow and pass through. It will reach even to the neck. The stretching out of its wings will fill the width of your land, O Immanuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make an uproar, you peoples, and be broken in pieces! Listen, all you from far countries: dress for battle, and be shattered! Dress for battle, and be shattered!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take counsel together, and it will be brought to nothing; speak the word, and it will not stand, for God is with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh spoke this to me with a strong hand, and instructed me not to walk in the way of this people, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t call a conspiracy all that this people call a conspiracy. Don’t fear their threats or be terrorized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies is who you must respect as holy. He is the one you must fear. He is the one you must dread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be a sanctuary, but for both houses of Israel, he will be a stumbling stone and a rock that makes them fall. For the people of Jerusalem, he will be a trap and a snare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many will stumble over it, fall, be broken, be snared, and be captured.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wrap up the covenant. Seal the law among my disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will wait for Yahweh, who hides his face from the house of Jacob, and I will look for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I and the children whom Yahweh has given me are for signs and for wonders in Israel from Yahweh of Armies, who dwells in Mount Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they tell you, “Consult with those who have familiar spirits and with the wizards, who chirp and who mutter,” shouldn’t a people consult with their God? Should they consult the dead on behalf of the living?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turn to the law and to the covenant! If they don’t speak according to this word, surely there is no morning for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will pass through it, very distressed and hungry. It will happen that when they are hungry, they will worry, and curse their king and their God. They will turn their faces upward,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then look to the earth and see distress, darkness, and the gloom of anguish. They will be driven into thick darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there shall be no more gloom for her who was in anguish. In the former time, he brought into contempt the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali; but in the latter time he has made it glorious, by the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people who walked in darkness have seen a great light.
    The light has shined on those who lived in the land of the shadow of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have multiplied the nation.
    You have increased their joy.
They rejoice before you according to the joy in harvest, as men rejoice when they divide the plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the yoke of his burden, and the staff of his shoulder, the rod of his oppressor, you have broken as in the day of Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the armor of the armed man in the noisy battle, and the garments rolled in blood, will be for burning, fuel for the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a child is born to us. A son is given to us; and the government will be on his shoulders. His name will be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the increase of his government and of peace there shall be no end, on David’s throne, and on his kingdom, to establish it, and to uphold it with justice and with righteousness from that time on, even forever. The zeal of Yahweh of Armies will perform this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord sent a word into Jacob,
    and it falls on Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the people will know,
    including Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria, who say in pride and in arrogance of heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The bricks have fallen,
    but we will build with cut stone.
The sycamore fig trees have been cut down,
    but we will put cedars in their place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore Yahweh will set up on high against him the adversaries of Rezin,
    and will stir up his enemies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Syrians in front,
    and the Philistines behind;
    and they will devour Israel with open mouth.
For all this, his anger is not turned away,
    but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet the people have not turned to him who struck them,
    neither have they sought Yahweh of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore Yahweh will cut off from Israel head and tail,
    palm branch and reed, in one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The elder and the honorable man is the head,
    and the prophet who teaches lies is the tail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For those who lead this people lead them astray;
    and those who are led by them are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For wickedness burns like a fire.
    It devours the briers and thorns;
    yes, it kindles in the thickets of the forest,
    and they roll upward in a column of smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Manasseh eating Ephraim and Ephraim eating Manasseh, and they together will be against Judah.
For all this his anger is not turned away,
    but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to those who decree unrighteous decrees, and to the writers who write oppressive decrees
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to deprive the needy of justice, and to rob the poor among my people of their rights, that widows may be their plunder, and that they may make the fatherless their prey!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What will you do in the day of visitation, and in the desolation which will come from afar? To whom will you flee for help? Where will you leave your wealth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will only bow down under the prisoners,
    and will fall under the slain.
For all this his anger is not turned away,
    but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Alas Assyrian, the rod of my anger, the staff in whose hand is my indignation!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send him against a profane nation, and against the people who anger me I will give him a command to take the plunder and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, he doesn’t mean so, neither does his heart think so; but it is in his heart to destroy, and to cut off not a few nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he says, “Aren’t all of my princes kings?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isn’t Calno like Carchemish? Isn’t Hamath like Arpad? Isn’t Samaria like Damascus?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As my hand has found the kingdoms of the idols, whose engraved images exceeded those of Jerusalem and of Samaria,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: shall I not, as I have done to Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and her idols?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it will happen that when the Lord has performed his whole work on Mount Zion and on Jerusalem, I will punish the fruit of the willful proud heart of the king of Assyria, and the insolence of his arrogant looks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he has said, “By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom, for I have understanding. I have removed the boundaries of the peoples, and have robbed their treasures. Like a valiant man I have brought down their rulers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My hand has found the riches of the peoples like a nest, and like one gathers eggs that are abandoned, I have gathered all the earth. There was no one who moved their wing, or that opened their mouth, or chirped.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should an ax brag against him who chops with it? Should a saw exalt itself above him who saws with it? As if a rod should lift those who lift it up, or as if a staff should lift up someone who is not wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, will send among his fat ones leanness; and under his glory a burning will be kindled like the burning of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The light of Israel will be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame; and it will burn and devour his thorns and his briers in one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will consume the glory of his forest and of his fruitful field, both soul and body. It will be as when a standard bearer faints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The remnant of the trees of his forest shall be few, so that a child could write their number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will come to pass in that day that the remnant of Israel, and those who have escaped from the house of Jacob will no more again lean on him who struck them, but shall lean on Yahweh, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A remnant will return, even the remnant of Jacob, to the mighty God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though your people, Israel, are like the sand of the sea, only a remnant of them will return. A destruction is determined, overflowing with righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, will make a full end, and that determined, throughout all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, says, “My people who dwell in Zion, don’t be afraid of the Assyrian, though he strike you with the rod, and lift up his staff against you, as Egypt did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For yet a very little while, and the indignation against you will be accomplished, and my anger will be directed to his destruction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies will stir up a scourge against him, as in the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb. His rod will be over the sea, and he will lift it up like he did against Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen in that day that his burden will depart from off your shoulder, and his yoke from off your neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed because of the anointing oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has come to Aiath. He has passed through Migron. At Michmash he stores his baggage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have gone over the pass. They have taken up their lodging at Geba. Ramah trembles. Gibeah of Saul has fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cry aloud with your voice, daughter of Gallim! Listen, Laishah! You poor Anathoth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Madmenah is a fugitive. The inhabitants of Gebim flee for safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This very day he will halt at Nob. He shakes his hand at the mountain of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, will lop the boughs with terror. The tall will be cut down, and the lofty will be brought low.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon will fall by the Mighty One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A shoot will come out of the stock of Jesse,
    and a branch out of his roots will bear fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh’s Spirit will rest on him:
    the spirit of wisdom and understanding,
    the spirit of counsel and might,
    the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
but he will judge the poor with righteousness,
    and decide with equity for the humble of the earth.
He will strike the earth with the rod of his mouth;
    and with the breath of his lips he will kill the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness will be the belt around his waist,
    and faithfulness the belt around his waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wolf will live with the lamb,
    and the leopard will lie down with the young goat,
    the calf, the young lion, and the fattened calf together;
    and a little child will lead them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cow and the bear will graze.
    Their young ones will lie down together.
    The lion will eat straw like the ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nursing child will play near a cobra’s hole,
    and the weaned child will put his hand on the viper’s den.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: It will happen in that day that the nations will seek the root of Jesse, who stands as a banner of the peoples; and his resting place will be glorious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen in that day that the Lord will set his hand again the second time to recover the remnant that is left of his people from Assyria, from Egypt, from Pathros, from Cush, from Elam, from Shinar, from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will set up a banner for the nations, and will assemble the outcasts of Israel, and gather together the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The envy also of Ephraim will depart, and those who persecute Judah will be cut off. Ephraim won’t envy Judah, and Judah won’t persecute Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fly down on the shoulders of the Philistines on the west. Together they will plunder the children of the east. They will extend their power over Edom and Moab, and the children of Ammon will obey them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh will utterly destroy the tongue of the Egyptian sea; and with his scorching wind he will wave his hand over the River, and will split it into seven streams, and cause men to march over in sandals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be a highway for the remnant that is left of his people from Assyria, like there was for Israel in the day that he came up out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day you will say, “I will give thanks to you, Yahweh; for though you were angry with me, your anger has turned away and you comfort me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, God is my salvation. I will trust, and will not be afraid; for Yah, Yahweh, is my strength and song; and he has become my salvation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore with joy you will draw water out of the wells of salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day you will say, “Give thanks to Yahweh! Call on his name! Declare his doings among the peoples! Proclaim that his name is exalted!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing to Yahweh, for he has done excellent things! Let this be known in all the earth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cry aloud and shout, you inhabitant of Zion, for the Holy One of Israel is great among you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz saw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set up a banner on the bare mountain! Lift up your voice to them! Wave your hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have commanded my consecrated ones; yes, I have called my mighty men for my anger, even my proudly exulting ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The noise of a multitude is in the mountains, as of a great people; the noise of an uproar of the kingdoms of the nations gathered together! Yahweh of Armies is mustering the army for the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They come from a far country, from the uttermost part of heaven, even Yahweh, and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wail, for Yahweh’s day is at hand! It will come as destruction from the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore all hands will be feeble, and everyone’s heart will melt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be dismayed. Pangs and sorrows will seize them. They will be in pain like a woman in labor. They will look in amazement one at another. Their faces will be faces of flame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the day of Yahweh comes, cruel, with wrath and fierce anger; to make the land a desolation, and to destroy its sinners out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the stars of the sky and its constellations will not give their light. The sun will be darkened in its going out, and the moon will not cause its light to shine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will punish the world for their evil, and the wicked for their iniquity. I will cause the arrogance of the proud to cease, and will humble the arrogance of the terrible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make people more rare than fine gold, even a person than the pure gold of Ophir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I will make the heavens tremble, and the earth will be shaken out of its place in Yahweh of Armies’ wrath, and in the day of his fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen that like a hunted gazelle and like sheep that no one gathers, they will each turn to their own people, and will each flee to their own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who is found will be thrust through. Everyone who is captured will fall by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their infants also will be dashed in pieces before their eyes. Their houses will be ransacked, and their wives raped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, who will not value silver, and as for gold, they will not delight in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their bows will dash the young men in pieces; and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb. Their eyes will not spare children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldeans’ pride, will be like when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will never be inhabited, neither will it be lived in from generation to generation. The Arabian will not pitch a tent there, neither will shepherds make their flocks lie down there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But wild animals of the desert will lie there, and their houses will be full of jackals. Ostriches will dwell there, and wild goats will frolic there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hyenas will cry in their fortresses, and jackals in the pleasant palaces. Her time is near to come, and her days will not be prolonged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh will have compassion on Jacob, and will yet choose Israel, and set them in their own land. The foreigner will join himself with them, and they will unite with the house of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The peoples will take them, and bring them to their place. The house of Israel will possess them in Yahweh’s land for servants and for handmaids. They will take as captives those whose captives they were; and they shall rule over their oppressors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen in the day that Yahweh will give you rest from your sorrow, from your trouble, and from the hard service in which you were made to serve,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you will take up this parable against the king of Babylon, and say, “How the oppressor has ceased! The golden city has ceased!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh has broken the staff of the wicked, the scepter of the rulers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who struck the peoples in wrath with a continual stroke, who ruled the nations in anger, with a persecution that no one restrained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole earth is at rest, and is quiet. They break out in song.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, the cypress trees rejoice with you, with the cedars of Lebanon, saying, “Since you are humbled, no lumberjack has come up against us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sheol from beneath has moved for you to meet you at your coming. It stirs up the departed spirits for you, even all the rulers of the earth. It has raised up from their thrones all the kings of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all will answer and ask you, “Have you also become as weak as we are? Have you become like us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your pomp is brought down to Sheol, with the sound of your stringed instruments. Maggots are spread out under you, and worms cover you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How you have fallen from heaven, shining one, son of the dawn! How you are cut down to the ground, who laid the nations low!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You said in your heart, “I will ascend into heaven! I will exalt my throne above the stars of God! I will sit on the mountain of assembly, in the far north!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will ascend above the heights of the clouds! I will make myself like the Most High!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you shall be brought down to Sheol, to the depths of the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who see you will stare at you. They will ponder you, saying, “Is this the man who made the earth to tremble, who shook kingdoms,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who made the world like a wilderness, and overthrew its cities, who didn’t release his prisoners to their home?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the kings of the nations sleep in glory, everyone in his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are cast away from your tomb like an abominable branch, clothed with the slain who are thrust through with the sword, who go down to the stones of the pit; like a dead body trodden under foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will not join them in burial, because you have destroyed your land. You have killed your people. The offspring of evildoers will not be named forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Prepare for slaughter of his children because of the iniquity of their fathers, that they not rise up and possess the earth, and fill the surface of the world with cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will rise up against them,” says Yahweh of Armies, “and cut off from Babylon name and remnant, and son and son’s son,” says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will also make it a possession for the porcupine, and pools of water. I will sweep it with the broom of destruction,” says Yahweh of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies has sworn, saying, “Surely, as I have thought, so shall it happen; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I will break the Assyrian in my land, and tread him under foot on my mountains. Then his yoke will leave them, and his burden leave their shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the plan that is determined for the whole earth. This is the hand that is stretched out over all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh of Armies has planned, and who can stop it? His hand is stretched out, and who can turn it back?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This burden was in the year that King Ahaz died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t rejoice, O Philistia, all of you, because the rod that struck you is broken; for out of the serpent’s root an adder will emerge, and his fruit will be a fiery flying serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The firstborn of the poor will eat, and the needy will lie down in safety; and I will kill your root with famine, and your remnant will be killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howl, gate! Cry, city! You are melted away, Philistia, all of you; for smoke comes out of the north, and there is no straggler in his ranks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What will they answer the messengers of the nation? That Yahweh has founded Zion, and in her the afflicted of his people will take refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden of Moab.
For in a night, Ar of Moab is laid waste, and brought to nothing. For in a night Kir of Moab is laid waste, and brought to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have gone up to Bayith, and to Dibon, to the high places, to weep. Moab wails over Nebo and over Medeba. Baldness is on all of their heads. Every beard is cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In their streets, they clothe themselves in sackcloth. In their streets and on their housetops, everyone wails, weeping abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heshbon cries out with Elealeh. Their voice is heard even to Jahaz. Therefore the armed men of Moab cry aloud. Their souls tremble within them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My heart cries out for Moab! Her nobles flee to Zoar, to Eglath Shelishiyah; for they go up by the ascent of Luhith with weeping; for on the way to Horonaim, they raise up a cry of destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the waters of Nimrim will be desolate; for the grass has withered away, the tender grass fails, there is no green thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they will carry away the abundance they have gotten, and that which they have stored up, over the brook of the willows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the cry has gone around the borders of Moab, its wailing to Eglaim, and its wailing to Beer Elim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the waters of Dimon are full of blood; for I will bring yet more on Dimon, a lion on those of Moab who escape, and on the remnant of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send the lambs for the ruler of the land from Selah to the wilderness, to the mountain of the daughter of Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it will be that as wandering birds, as a scattered nest, so will the daughters of Moab be at the fords of the Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give counsel! Execute justice! Make your shade like the night in the middle of the noonday! Hide the outcasts! Don’t betray the fugitive!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let my outcasts dwell with you! As for Moab, be a hiding place for him from the face of the destroyer. For the extortionist is brought to nothing. Destruction ceases. The oppressors are consumed out of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A throne will be established in loving kindness. One will sit on it in truth, in the tent of David, judging, seeking justice, and swift to do righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have heard of the pride of Moab, that he is very proud; even of his arrogance, his pride, and his wrath. His boastings are nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Moab will wail for Moab. Everyone will wail. You will mourn for the raisin cakes of Kir Hareseth, utterly stricken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the fields of Heshbon languish with the vine of Sibmah. The lords of the nations have broken down its choice branches, which reached even to Jazer, which wandered into the wilderness. Its shoots were spread abroad. They passed over the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I will weep with the weeping of Jazer for the vine of Sibmah. I will water you with my tears, Heshbon, and Elealeh: for on your summer fruits and on your harvest the battle shout has fallen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gladness is taken away, and joy out of the fruitful field; and in the vineyards there will be no singing, neither joyful noise. Nobody will tread out wine in the presses. I have made the shouting stop.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore my heart sounds like a harp for Moab, and my inward parts for Kir Heres.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen that when Moab presents himself, when he wearies himself on the high place, and comes to his sanctuary to pray, that he will not prevail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that Yahweh spoke concerning Moab in time past.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now Yahweh has spoken, saying, “Within three years, as a worker bound by contract would count them, the glory of Moab shall be brought into contempt, with all his great multitude; and the remnant will be very small and feeble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden of Damascus.
“Behold, Damascus is taken away from being a city, and it will be a ruinous heap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities of Aroer are forsaken. They will be for flocks, which shall lie down, and no one shall make them afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fortress shall cease from Ephraim, and the kingdom from Damascus, and the remnant of Syria. They will be as the glory of the children of Israel,” says Yahweh of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It will happen in that day that the glory of Jacob will be made thin, and the fatness of his flesh will become lean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be like when the harvester gathers the wheat, and his arm reaps the grain. Yes, it will be like when one gleans grain in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet gleanings will be left there, like the shaking of an olive tree, two or three olives in the top of the uppermost bough, four or five in the outermost branches of a fruitful tree,” says Yahweh, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day, people will look to their Maker, and their eyes will have respect for the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will not look to the altars, the work of their hands; neither shall they respect that which their fingers have made, either the Asherah poles or the incense altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day, their strong cities will be like the forsaken places in the woods and on the mountain top, which were forsaken from before the children of Israel; and it will be a desolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have forgotten the God of your salvation, and have not remembered the rock of your strength. Therefore you plant pleasant plants, and set out foreign seedlings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the day of your planting, you hedge it in. In the morning, you make your seed blossom, but the harvest flees away in the day of grief and of desperate sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ah, the uproar of many peoples who roar like the roaring of the seas; and the rushing of nations that rush like the rushing of mighty waters!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nations will rush like the rushing of many waters, but he will rebuke them, and they will flee far off, and will be chased like the chaff of the mountains before the wind, and like the whirling dust before the storm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At evening, behold, terror! Before the morning, they are no more. This is the portion of those who plunder us, and the lot of those who rob us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ah, the land of the rustling of wings, which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that sends ambassadors by the sea, even in vessels of papyrus on the waters, saying, “Go, you swift messengers, to a nation tall and smooth, to a people awesome from their beginning onward, a nation that measures out and treads down, whose land the rivers divide!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All you inhabitants of the world, and you dwellers on the earth, when a banner is lifted up on the mountains, look! When the trumpet is blown, listen!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh said to me, “I will be still, and I will see in my dwelling place, like clear heat in sunshine, like a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For before the harvest, when the blossom is over, and the flower becomes a ripening grape, he will cut off the sprigs with pruning hooks, and he will cut down and take away the spreading branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be left together for the ravenous birds of the mountains, and for the animals of the earth. The ravenous birds will eat them in the summer, and all the animals of the earth will eat them in the winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that time, a present will be brought to Yahweh of Armies from a people tall and smooth, even from a people awesome from their beginning onward, a nation that measures out and treads down, whose land the rivers divide, to the place of the name of Yahweh of Armies, Mount Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden of Egypt.
“Behold, Yahweh rides on a swift cloud, and comes to Egypt. The idols of Egypt will tremble at his presence; and the heart of Egypt will melt within it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will stir up the Egyptians against the Egyptians, and they will fight everyone against his brother, and everyone against his neighbor; city against city, and kingdom against kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirit of the Egyptians will fail within them. I will destroy their counsel. They will seek the idols, the charmers, those who have familiar spirits, and the wizards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give over the Egyptians into the hand of a cruel lord. A fierce king will rule over them,” says the Lord, Yahweh of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The waters will fail from the sea, and the river will be wasted and become dry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rivers will become foul. The streams of Egypt will be diminished and dried up. The reeds and flags will wither away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The meadows by the Nile, by the brink of the Nile, and all the sown fields of the Nile, will become dry, be driven away, and be no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fishermen will lament, and all those who fish in the Nile will mourn, and those who spread nets on the waters will languish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover those who work in combed flax, and those who weave white cloth, will be confounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pillars will be broken in pieces. All those who work for hire will be grieved in soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The princes of Zoan are utterly foolish. The counsel of the wisest counselors of Pharaoh has become stupid. How do you say to Pharaoh, “I am the son of the wise, the son of ancient kings”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where then are your wise men? Let them tell you now; and let them know what Yahweh of Armies has purposed concerning Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The princes of Zoan have become fools. The princes of Memphis are deceived. They have caused Egypt to go astray, those who are the cornerstone of her tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh has mixed a spirit of perverseness in the middle of her; and they have caused Egypt to go astray in all of its works, like a drunken man staggers in his vomit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither shall there be any work for Egypt, which head or tail, palm branch or rush, may do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day the Egyptians will be like women. They will tremble and fear because of the shaking of Yahweh of Armies’s hand, which he shakes over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land of Judah will become a terror to Egypt. Everyone to whom mention is made of it will be afraid, because of the plans of Yahweh of Armies, which he determines against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day, there will be five cities in the land of Egypt that speak the language of Canaan, and swear to Yahweh of Armies. One will be called “The city of destruction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day, there will be an altar to Yahweh in the middle of the land of Egypt, and a pillar to Yahweh at its border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be for a sign and for a witness to Yahweh of Armies in the land of Egypt; for they will cry to Yahweh because of oppressors, and he will send them a savior and a defender, and he will deliver them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh will be known to Egypt, and the Egyptians will know Yahweh in that day. Yes, they will worship with sacrifice and offering, and will vow a vow to Yahweh, and will perform it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh will strike Egypt, striking and healing. They will return to Yahweh, and he will be entreated by them, and will heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day there will be a highway out of Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrian shall come into Egypt, and the Egyptian into Assyria; and the Egyptians will worship with the Assyrians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day, Israel will be the third with Egypt and with Assyria, a blessing within the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Yahweh of Armies has blessed them, saying, “Blessed be Egypt my people, Assyria the work of my hands, and Israel my inheritance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the year that Tartan came to Ashdod, when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him, and he fought against Ashdod and took it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at that time Yahweh spoke by Isaiah the son of Amoz, saying, “Go, and loosen the sackcloth from off your waist, and take your sandals from off your feet.” He did so, walking naked and barefoot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said, “As my servant Isaiah has walked naked and barefoot three years for a sign and a wonder concerning Egypt and concerning Ethiopia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so the king of Assyria will lead away the captives of Egypt and the exiles of Ethiopia, young and old, naked and barefoot, and with buttocks uncovered, to the shame of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be dismayed and confounded, because of Ethiopia their expectation, and of Egypt their glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The inhabitants of this coast land will say in that day, ‘Behold, this is our expectation, where we fled for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria. And we, how will we escape?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden of the wilderness of the sea.
As whirlwinds in the South sweep through, it comes from the wilderness, from an awesome land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A grievous vision is declared to me. The treacherous man deals treacherously, and the destroyer destroys. Go up, Elam; attack! I have stopped all of Media’s sighing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore my thighs are filled with anguish. Pains have seized me, like the pains of a woman in labor. I am in so much pain that I can’t hear. I am so dismayed that I can’t see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My heart flutters. Horror has frightened me. The twilight that I desired has been turned into trembling for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They prepare the table. They set the watch. They eat. They drink. Rise up, you princes, oil the shield!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord said to me, “Go, set a watchman. Let him declare what he sees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he sees a troop, horsemen in pairs, a troop of donkeys, a troop of camels, he shall listen diligently with great attentiveness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cried like a lion: “Lord, I stand continually on the watchtower in the daytime, and every night I stay at my post.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, here comes a troop of men, horsemen in pairs.” He answered, “Fallen, fallen is Babylon; and all the engraved images of her gods are broken to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are my threshing, and the grain of my floor!” That which I have heard from Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, I have declared to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden of Dumah.
One calls to me out of Seir, “Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The watchman said, “The morning comes, and also the night. If you will inquire, inquire. Come back again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden on Arabia.
You will lodge in the thickets in Arabia, you caravans of Dedanites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought water to him who was thirsty. The inhabitants of the land of Tema met the fugitives with their bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they fled away from the swords, from the drawn sword, from the bent bow, and from the heat of battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord said to me, “Within a year, as a worker bound by contract would count it, all the glory of Kedar will fail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the residue of the number of the archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, will be few; for Yahweh, the God of Israel, has spoken it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden of the valley of vision.
What ails you now, that you have all gone up to the housetops?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You that are full of shouting, a tumultuous city, a joyous town, your slain are not slain with the sword, neither are they dead in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All your rulers fled away together. They were bound by the archers. All who were found by you were bound together. They fled far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I said, “Look away from me. I will weep bitterly. Don’t labor to comfort me for the destruction of the daughter of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is a day of confusion, and of treading down, and of perplexity from the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, in the valley of vision, a breaking down of the walls, and a crying to the mountains.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elam carried his quiver, with chariots of men and horsemen; and Kir uncovered the shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your choicest valleys were full of chariots, and the horsemen set themselves in array at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took away the covering of Judah; and you looked in that day to the armor in the house of the forest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You saw the breaches of David’s city, that they were many; and you gathered together the waters of the lower pool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You counted the houses of Jerusalem, and you broke down the houses to fortify the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also made a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the old pool. But you didn’t look to him who had done this, neither did you have respect for him who planned it long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day, the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, called to weeping, to mourning, to baldness, and to dressing in sackcloth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and behold, there is joy and gladness, killing cattle and killing sheep, eating meat and drinking wine: “Let’s eat and drink, for tomorrow we will die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies revealed himself in my ears, “Surely this iniquity will not be forgiven you until you die,” says the Lord, Yahweh of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord, Yahweh of Armies says, “Go, get yourself to this treasurer, even to Shebna, who is over the house, and say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘What are you doing here? Who has you here, that you have dug out a tomb here?’ Cutting himself out a tomb on high, chiseling a habitation for himself in the rock!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, Yahweh will overcome you and hurl you away violently. Yes, he will grasp you firmly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will surely wind you around and around, and throw you like a ball into a large country. There you will die, and there the chariots of your glory will be, you disgrace of your lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will thrust you from your office. You will be pulled down from your station.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen in that day that I will call my servant Eliakim the son of Hilkiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will clothe him with your robe, and strengthen him with your belt. I will commit your government into his hand; and he will be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and to the house of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will lay the key of David’s house on his shoulder. He will open, and no one will shut. He will shut, and no one will open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will fasten him like a nail in a sure place. He will be for a throne of glory to his father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will hang on him all the glory of his father’s house, the offspring and the issue, every small vessel, from the cups even to all the pitchers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In that day,” says Yahweh of Armies, “the nail that was fastened in a sure place will give way. It will be cut down and fall. The burden that was on it will be cut off, for Yahweh has spoken it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The burden of Tyre.
Howl, you ships of Tarshish! For it is laid waste, so that there is no house, no entering in. From the land of Kittim it is revealed to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be still, you inhabitants of the coast, you whom the merchants of Sidon that pass over the sea have replenished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On great waters, the seed of the Shihor, the harvest of the Nile, was her revenue. She was the market of nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ashamed, Sidon; for the sea has spoken, the stronghold of the sea, saying, “I have not travailed, nor given birth, neither have I nourished young men, nor brought up virgins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the report comes to Egypt, they will be in anguish at the report of Tyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pass over to Tarshish! Wail, you inhabitants of the coast!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is this your joyous city, whose antiquity is of ancient days, whose feet carried her far away to travel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who has planned this against Tyre, the giver of crowns, whose merchants are princes, whose traders are the honorable of the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh of Armies has planned it, to stain the pride of all glory, to bring into contempt all the honorable of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pass through your land like the Nile, daughter of Tarshish. There is no restraint any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has stretched out his hand over the sea. He has shaken the kingdoms. Yahweh has ordered the destruction of Canaan’s strongholds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “You shall rejoice no more, you oppressed virgin daughter of Sidon. Arise, pass over to Kittim. Even there you will have no rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the land of the Chaldeans. This people didn’t exist. The Assyrians founded it for those who dwell in the wilderness. They set up their towers. They overthrew its palaces. They made it a ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howl, you ships of Tarshish, for your stronghold is laid waste!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will come to pass in that day that Tyre will be forgotten seventy years, according to the days of one king. After the end of seventy years it will be to Tyre like in the song of the prostitute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take a harp; go about the city, you prostitute that has been forgotten. Make sweet melody. Sing many songs, that you may be remembered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen after the end of seventy years that Yahweh will visit Tyre. She will return to her wages, and will play the prostitute with all the kingdoms of the world on the surface of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her merchandise and her wages will be holiness to Yahweh. It will not be treasured nor laid up; for her merchandise will be for those who dwell before Yahweh, to eat sufficiently, and for durable clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, Yahweh makes the earth empty, makes it waste, turns it upside down, and scatters its inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be as with the people, so with the priest; as with the servant, so with his master; as with the maid, so with her mistress; as with the buyer, so with the seller; as with the creditor, so with the debtor; as with the taker of interest, so with the giver of interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth will be utterly emptied and utterly laid waste; for Yahweh has spoken this word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth mourns and fades away. The world languishes and fades away. The lofty people of the earth languish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth also is polluted under its inhabitants, because they have transgressed the laws, violated the statutes, and broken the everlasting covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the curse has devoured the earth, and those who dwell therein are found guilty. Therefore the inhabitants of the earth are burned, and few men are left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The new wine mourns. The vine languishes. All the merry-hearted sigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mirth of tambourines ceases. The sound of those who rejoice ends. The joy of the harp ceases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will not drink wine with a song. Strong drink will be bitter to those who drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The confused city is broken down. Every house is shut up, that no man may come in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a crying in the streets because of the wine. All joy is darkened. The mirth of the land is gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city is left in desolation, and the gate is struck with destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it will be so within the earth among the peoples, as the shaking of an olive tree, as the gleanings when the vintage is done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These shall lift up their voice. They will shout for the majesty of Yahweh. They cry aloud from the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore glorify Yahweh in the east, even the name of Yahweh, the God of Israel, in the islands of the sea!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs. Glory to the righteous!
But I said, “I pine away! I pine away! woe is me!” The treacherous have dealt treacherously. Yes, the treacherous have dealt very treacherously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear, the pit, and the snare are on you who inhabit the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen that he who flees from the noise of the fear will fall into the pit; and he who comes up out of the middle of the pit will be taken in the snare; for the windows on high are opened, and the foundations of the earth tremble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth is utterly broken. The earth is torn apart. The earth is shaken violently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth will stagger like a drunken man, and will sway back and forth like a hammock. Its disobedience will be heavy on it, and it will fall and not rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will happen in that day that Yahweh will punish the army of the high ones on high, and the kings of the earth on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be gathered together, as prisoners are gathered in the pit, and will be shut up in the prison; and after many days they will be visited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the moon will be confounded, and the sun ashamed; for Yahweh of Armies will reign on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem; and glory will be before his elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh, you are my God. I will exalt you! I will praise your name, for you have done wonderful things, things planned long ago, in complete faithfulness and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have made a city into a heap, a fortified city into a ruin, a palace of strangers to be no city. It will never be built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore a strong people will glorify you. A city of awesome nations will fear you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have been a stronghold to the poor, a stronghold to the needy in his distress, a refuge from the storm, a shade from the heat, when the blast of the dreaded ones is like a storm against the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator
